doc.abstracts: In November and December 2003, February and April 2004, and February 2005, Lester Nurick was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Dr. Robert P. Grathwol. During his tenure at the Bank from 1946 to 1980, Mr. Nurick served in the legal department as associate general counsel (1946-1979) and vice president and general counsel (1979-1980). After serving in the army, working at a law firm, and working at the securities and exchange commission, he joined the World Bank. His transcript concerns the presidencies of Eugene meyer, John J. McCloy, Eugene Black, George Woods, and Robert McNamara.
